title: Ticket #2035: Omit _CONDOR_JOB_PIDS and _CONDOR_JOB_IWD from env if not ssh_to_job
description:
The condor_starter always sets the environment variables _CONDOR_JOB_PIDS and _CONDOR_JOB_IWD when starting a job. They're intended for condor_ssh_to_job, but are present for the basic job. This is unnecessarily confusing.

Proposed:

  • Don't set _CONDOR_JOB_PIDS when starting the basic job. It's empty anyway, so it's entirely deadweight.
  • Either remove _CONDOR_JOB_IWD when starting a basic job (it's intended for condor_ssh_to_job, is redundant with the actual IWD, and deadweight), or document it as a feature in manual section 2.5.5 (Users' Manual > Submitting a Job > Environment Variables)
remarks:
2011-Apr-04 15:05:26 by matt:
How are they confusing?

They are useful from a job and hook perspective.
